contentrichtext.text: '''Queens Park''' is a significant park in [[Moonee Ponds]] in the City of [[Melbourne]], [[Australia]] [[Image:World war memorial at Queens Park in Moonee Ponds.jpg|thumbnail|right|250px|The World War memorial at Queens Park]] == Location == Located in [[Moonee Ponds]] bound by the following roads; [[Mount Alexander Road, Melbourne|Mount Alexander Road]], The Strand, Pascoe Vale Road, Kellaway Avenue == History == Early travellers heading for the goldfields met here because fresh water was available in the lagoon. [[Burke and Wills]] camped here on their fateful journey to cross [[Australia]]. == Description == A picturesque cottage is the focal point of the park with its idyllic surrounds and lovely public art pieces. A gravel path surrounds the lake where seats and picnic tables are provided beneath old established exotic trees, with the lake a haven for a variety of birds. A rose garden and a sunken garden are part of the many attractions of the park. Concerts and other entertainments are common on weekends. == Facilities within the park == * Moonee Ponds Bowling Club : http://www.mooneepondsbowls.com.au * Queens Park Pool <gallery> Image:Fountain in Queens Park in Moonee Ponds, in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.jpg|The fountain in Queens park </gallery> == External links == * Moonee Valley City Council : http://www.mvcc.vic.gov.au * History Of Queens Park : http://www.enet.org.au/historyonline/queens/queenspark.html {{Parks in Melbourne}} {{coord|-37.7625|144.9242|type:landmark_region:AU|display=title}} [[Category:Parks in Melbourne]]
